## Mono Lake water level change data visulaization

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(tidyverse)
library(paletteer)
library(janitor)
library(here)
library(scales)

# read in data
mono <- read_csv(here("data","mono_lake_annual_levels.csv"), skip = 5)

# cleaning up the data
mono_tidy <- clean_names(mono) %>% 
  rename(lake_level = lake_level_feet_above_sea_level)

```

```{r}
# visualizing the data
ggplot(data = mono_tidy, aes(x = year, y = lake_level)) +
  geom_line(aes(color = lake_level)) +
  scale_x_continuous(c(1850:2015), breaks = breaks_extended(25)) +
  geom_rect(aes(ymin= 6370, ymax= 6377, xmin=1850, xmax=2020), alpha = 0.009, fill='red') +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.title = element_blank()) +
  labs(x = "Year", y = "Lake Level (Feet above Sea Level", title = "Change in Water Level of Mono Lake") +
  annotate("text", x = 1940, y = 6378, label = "Landbridge Elevation",
           family = "serif", fontface = "italic", colour = "black", size = 3)
  
  

```
<center>**Figure 1:** Change in water level of Mono Lake, monitored from 1850 - 2016. Water level is in feet above sea level. A red highlight denotes the water level that reveals landbridges under the surface, allowing predation to occur and changing the perimeter of the lake. </center>
